intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create a simple Motwin server application.
Don't forget to check each step before going to the next one.
Make sure you use the exact values indicated in the cheat sheet scenario. Otherwise, you may not be able to use automatic actions provided in the cheat sheet.

item.title: Open the new Motwin Server Project Wizard
item.description: Select "File > New > Project...", choose "Motwin > Server Project" and click "Next". Or click the link below.

item.title: Give a Project Name
item.description: Enter the project name as "my-application" and click the "Next".

item.title: Fill in the Bundle Information
item.description: You can change the default values of the Bundle Information or keep them as they are.

item.title: Select the MOS Runtime
item.description:
Select your Virgo / MOS runtime, or create a new one by clicking "New" and following the steps in the New Runtime wizard.
Selecting your MOS runtime enables you to configure your project classpath with the jar files that are deployed in your targeted MOS runtime.

item.title: Complete
item.description: Click "Finish" to create your Motwin server project.
item.onCompletion:
Congratulations! You have just created a Motwin server project.
You can open the "application.xml" file (in "src/main/resources/META-INF/spring/") with the Spring Config Editor to start creating Motwin beans such as channels, interceptors, message processors, etc.
The tabs Motwin Channel, Motwin Messaging and Motwin Requesting of the Spring Config Editor will guide you to create these Motwin beans.
